result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Thatcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
COUNTS 3, 4, and 8: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at ZERO.
- No Contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
- No Contact with victim L.T., unless approved by the agent.

- A court in Anger Management.
- Mental Health Evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- As determined by the agent, defendant may attend counseling with victim.

- AODA treatment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Thatcher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven J Thatcher in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
CLARIFICATION to plea entry dates 7/12/2016 to reflect remaining cases Dismissed, But Read In.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, Deborah M., and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, AND 8 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 days (on count 3) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim L.T. unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Restitution set at ZERO.
-As determined by the agent, defendant may attend counseling with victim.

*Court denies transfer of probation to Arizona until further order from the court*

Probation Review Hearing in Branch 24.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, AND 8 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, AND 11 AMENDED
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered counts Dismissed, But Read In.

Defendant Steven J Thatcher in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Second Amended Information, received and filed. 

SECOND AMENDED INFORMATION READS:
Count 1: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.
Count 2: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), 939.50(3)(h), and 939.63(1)(b), a Class H Felony. 
Count 3: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 4: Misdemeanor Intimidation of a Victim, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.44(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Midemeanor.
Count 5: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), 939.50(3)(h) and 939.63(1)(b), a Class H Felony.
Count 6: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), 939.50(3)(h) and 939.63(1)(b), a Class H Felony.
Count 7: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), 939.50(3)(h) and 939.63(1)(b), a Class H Felony.
Count 8: Child Neglect (Misdemeanor), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 9: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.
Count 10: Felony Intimidation of a Victim, contrary to Wisconsin Statues section(s) 940.45(3) and 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.
Count 11: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(2)(b), and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
